event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: Two I/O boats appear, to the management software, to be in the same location in an External I/O Expansion Unit
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
One of the boat location signals is faulty. Physically check the serial numbers of the boat detected by the system to determine which reported location is correct. The signal failure is in the chassis or the boat. It is also possible that the system will not be able to determine a boat location if there is a problem with the I2C bus. This event commonly occurs during the initialization of the uplink card and result in only be able to access the down link card. The uplink and boat won't be managed.

You may see the fault message IOXSCF-8000-U4 associated with this error.

Follow the steps below to obtain the necessary data for presentation to your authorized service provider.

Step 1: Collect the fault message.
A single line fault message is displayed to the system console and logged in the /var/logs/message file. The complete message may be retrieved by using the 'fmdump' command on the XSCF console as shown below.

Example:

LEGEND:
RED = SUNW-MSG-ID
BLUE = EVENT_ID
GREEN = FRU

XSCF> fmdump -m
   MSG-ID: IOXSCF-8001-AD, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 08:39:02 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: server-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 88974baa-7d18-499e-9352-1177cb0a78cd
   DESC: Two I/O boats appear, to the management software, to be in the
   same location in an External I/O Expansion Unit
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/IOXSCF-8001-AD for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: No immediate action is taken
   IMPACT: One I/O boat will not be monitored.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.

Step 2: Collect the "fmdump" output.
Use the fmdump command with the Event-ID option to retrieve more information on the fault which has occurred.

Example:

XSCF> fmdump -v -u 88974baa-7d18-499e-9352-1177cb0a78cd
   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 27 08:39:02.7474 88974baa-7d18-499e-9352-1177cb0a78cd IOXSCF-8001-AD
       100% fault.chassis.iox.boat-access
       Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/pcislot=2/link=0/cable=0
          Affects: -
              FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
0/component=/IOU#0/PCI#2/LINK/CABLE

Step 3: Provide the output collected to your service provider.
The information collected above will help your service provider to schedule a repair at your convenience.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: One I/O boat will not be monitored.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
event_registry_properties.item: External I/O Expansion Unit I/O boat location failure
